snippet: Sheldon Silver, the Assembly speaker, said his Democratic caucus supported measures to close campaign finance loopholes, an assertion that came after lawmakers had unsuccessfully lobbied for a raise.
abstract: New York State Assembly Democrats challenge Gov Andrew M Cuomo’s assertion that they have shown little interest in ethics reform; say they will back proposals to help curb influence of money in state government.

byline.original: By SUSANNE CRAIG and THOMAS KAPLAN

lead_paragraph: Sheldon Silver, the Assembly speaker, said his Democratic caucus supported measures to close campaign finance loopholes, an assertion that came after lawmakers had unsuccessfully lobbied for a raise.

headline.main: Democrats in New York Assembly Say They Support Ethics Reform
headline.print_headline: Democrats Say They Support Ethics Reform
